--- title: "Markdown Escape Tool ‚Äî Edge Case Corpus" description: "A compact but brutal set of Markdown edge cases to test escaping." tags: [markdown, escaping, edge-cases, fuzz] --- # 0. Front matter + first ATX heading with trailing hashes ###### Paragraph with **bold**, *italic*, ***bold-italic***, and ~~strikethrough~~. Underscore pitfalls: this_has_underscores, and also __double__underscores__ next_to text. Words_with_internal_underscores should not become italic. Emoji & entities: :smile: & < > " ¬© 2025 ‚Äî check normalization: caf√©, na√Øve, üòä. Bare URLs vs autolinks: https://example.com?x=1&y=2 should autolink; angle autolink should include parentheses. Email autolink: ## 1. Inline code spans (backtick gymnastics) Correct handling of backticks: - Simple: `code` - With backtick inside: ``Use a `literal backtick` here`` - With spaces at ends: `` ` spaced ` `` (should preserve inner spaces) - Triple: ```a```b```c``` - Edge: ```` fence ``` inside ```` ## 2. Fenced code blocks (backticks vs tildes, language hints, nested fences) ```js // Backtick fence with language hint const s = `template ${'`literal`'} string`; console.log(s); ``` ~~~~md # Tilde fence; inner backticks should be literal: ``` not a fence ``` ~~~~ ```text ````` // five-backtick opener below should close correctly ``` still code ``` ````` ``` ## 3. Links & images (titles, parentheses, escaped chars) Inline link with nested parentheses: [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-3.4(abc)). Title needing quotes: [quoted title](https://example.com "A \"double-quoted\" title & more"). Image inline: ![Alt text with [brackets] & (parens)](https://via.placeholder.com/120x60.png?text=Md![x](y) "img (title)") Image ref: ![logo][logo-ref] Reference-style link: see [the spec][CommonMark]. Duplicate ref labels (case-insensitive): [dup][Dup], [dup2][DUP]. Malicious-ish scheme (should be sanitized by renderers): [click me](javascript:alert('xss')). ## 4. Tables (pipes, alignment, escapes) | Key \| Pipe | Value \& Amp | Note | |:------|:-----:|---------------------------| | `a\|b` | 1 | Pipes in code cell | | text | 2 | Escaped \| visible | | col3 | 3 | Long text with **bold** and `code` | ## 5. Lists (ordered, unordered, task, edge numbering) Unordered: - item 1 - item 2 - nested - deep Ordered with tricky numbering and resets: 1. one 2. two 1. sub-one 9. sub-two (should render as "2." or "9." depending on parser) 3. three Task list + blockquotes in items: - [ ] todo - [x] done - [ ] quote below: > nested quote >> double nest ## 6. Blockquotes + HTML comments > Quote line 1 > > Quote line 3 after blank > Final quoted line ## 7. Setext headings + trailing characters Heading A ======== Heading B with trailing hashes ### ---------------------------------- ## 8. HTML-in-Markdown (tags, attributes, scripts)
Raw HTML should pass through.
## 9. Footnotes, definitions, and collisions Footnote test: Here is a fact.[^1] And another.[^note] Term : Definition with **formatting** and `code`. Another Term : Multi-line : Second definition paragraph. [^1]: Footnote *one*. [^NOTE]: Footnote label case-insensitivity. ## 10. Escaped punctuation & special cases Escaped characters: \* \_ \# \\ \` \{ \} \[ \] \( \) \> \+ \- \. \! \| At mentions and hashes: @user #hashtag should be literal. Hard line breaks (two spaces at EOL) This line should be the same paragraph but new line. Soft wrap vs paragraph: this is a long line \ with a backslash line break. ## 11. Mixed RTL/LTR & bidi controls Arabic + English: ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ÿ®Ÿãÿß (hello) world ‚Äî ensure punctuation stays put. Hebrew + code: ◊©◊ú◊ï◊ù `printf("hi");` ‚Äî watch bidi. ## 12. Math-ish content (dollar signs) Inline $x + y = z$ and escaped \$not math\$. Block math fence (if renderer supports): $$ E = mc^2 \quad \text{and} \quad \int_0^\infty e^{-x}\,dx = 1 $$ ## 13. Images & links with reference definitions at end [logo-ref]: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a7/React-icon.svg "React \"logo\"" [CommonMark]: https://spec.commonmark.org/current/ "CommonMark Spec" [dup]: https://example.org/dup [dup2]: https://example.org/dup2
